main event: In April 1949, a witness in Morgantown, West Virginia observed a disc-shaped, yellowish, glowing object with a long, tapering trail of flame moving across the sky at a high altitude.
interesting points: The witness observed a similar object following the same route at a similar speed and altitude later in the month.
Weather reports and police department records were checked and included in the investigation report.
The object emitted a long, yellowish, tapering trail of flame.
A witness in the real estate business observed another object in the same vicinity with a reddish golden tint and flattened funnel shape in March 1952.
The object maintained straight and level flight, leaving a persistent dark red trail similar to that previously sighted.
sighted object: disc-shaped, yellowish, glowing object with a long, tapering trail of flame
photographs: no photographs included in the report
